fields.name: Top 20 countries by land area and population
fields.query:
title1 = 'Top 10 countries by land area'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:10]
data1 = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r]

title2 = 'Top 10 countries by population'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-population')[:10]
data2 = [[o.name, o.population] for o in r]
fields.description: Top 20 countries by land area and population

fields.name: Top 20 countries by land area and population 2
fields.template:
{% extends "base.html" %} {% load chartkick %} {% block content %}

Django Graph Pages

This template displays two pie charts side by side in a fluid grid.

{{ title1 }}

{% pie_chart data1 with id='chart-1' %} Back

{{ title2 }}

{% pie_chart data2 with id='chart-2' %} Back
{% endblock content %}

fields.name: Top N countries by land area and population with query form
fields.form:
class GraphForm(forms.Form):
    title = forms.CharField(min_length=3, max_length=80, label='Title')
    number_countries = forms.IntegerField(max_value=50, min_value=5,
                                          label='Number of countries')
fields.template:
{% extends "base.html" %} {% load chartkick %} {% query %} title1 = 'Top {{number_countries}} countries by land area' r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:{{number_countries}}] data1 = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r] title2 = 'Top {{number_countries}} countries by population' r = CIA.objects.order_by('-population')[:{{number_countries}}] data2 = [[o.name, o.population] for o in r] {% endquery %} {% block content %}
